OMNIHORIZON

OmniHorizon

An Outdoors Omnidirectional Dataset for Depth and Normal Estimation


Jay Bhanushali

Manivannan M.

Touchlab, Department of Applied Mechanics,
Indian Institute of Technology Madras,
Chennai - 600036

Abstract



A lot of work has been done in recent years towards the tasks of monocular depth and surface normal estimation from omnidirectional images. However, the work has been largely restricted to indoor datasets. We propose a synthetic stereo-omnidirectional dataset: OmniHorizon with 25K images for depth and normal estimation in outdoor scenarios. The dataset provides a wider context for scenery such as buildings, streets and vegetation. The dataset also accounts for dynamic lighting in the scene, pedestrians and traffic. We demonstrate the results from the network trained on the OmniHorizon on real world images.
